website_summaries.verdict: Tough, feature-packed circular saw for hard-working pros. The best available right now.
cons: Not everyone likes the rubber levers

customer_reviews.title: Cuts in plywood have been great, especially when using the scoring feature to reduce ...
customer_reviews.text: I construct kitchen cabinetry and furniture as a side business and I don't know why I haven't bought this sooner. I recently cut a 2" thick, 3'x6' Oak top for a kitchen island (both rip and crosscut) and this saw handled it. Cuts in plywood have been great, especially when using the scoring feature to reduce tear-out. The only thing about this saw that had me on the fence was that it didn't have a riving knife, but that has been a non-issue. I also haven't had an issue with any of the two tracks I purchased. Kickback, it can happen with any circular saw, just take your time.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Only good for plywood
customer_reviews.text: Not good for cutting hardwoods thicker than 1". Bogs down then veers right or left, cutting into the track in hardwoods that are 1 5/8" thick. Ruined two tracks. Even making multiple, more shallow passes does not work. Emailed Makita tech support with no reply.
customer_reviews.author: Hilton

customer_reviews.title: Pretty dang handy
customer_reviews.text: Note, this saw will not replace a table saw but works great for breaking down 4'x8' sheet goods. I didn't realize the depth scale on this saw was in metric only. The metric scale takes some time to get used to but works well. The saw itself is made very well and cuts straight. Cuts do not splinter on rips and very little on crosscuts when using the scoring feature. The saw could use more power, however, but works good for cuts in 3/4" plywood. The videos I've seen of this saw in action are deceiving in regards to the power and versatility.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Miller

customer_reviews.title: One immediate change makes this a very nice saw
customer_reviews.text: Step 1. Remove blade and throw in garbage. Step 2. Install a Freud Diablo plywood/finish blade. You NOW have a super nice track saw. I made my first cut with the factory blade, which appears to be a nice blade until you see how it cuts. It left burn marks on a 3/4" plywood sheet, and is 3/16 thick. The Freud Diablo blade I mentioned above is 1/16 (less waste), and cuts more smoothly and without burns. My only other criticism of this is that the instructions do not have very good pictures in it that reference what they are talking about. Overall I am very happy with this purchase so far.
customer_reviews.author: BrewerOfBOOM

customer_reviews.title: Where has this thing been all my life?
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the money - particularly compared to other track saws on the market. This is a quality tool. It works. The track is reliable and the soft start on the saw really improves confidence that the track is reliably still where you put it. This tool and its accessories are a vital part of nearly every wood project that I've worked on since I got it. I have 2 of the 55" tracks, the 39" track, the track connector, track clamps, and the miter attachment. I have not used the miter attachment yet; but, everything else works really well.
customer_reviews.author: B. Volkert

customer_reviews.title: Great plastic toy saw
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to receive this was until I picked it up and discovered almost the entire saw was made from children's plastic. I didn't even use it and sent it back - ordering the dewalt track saw, which is a lot better quality. Makita built an expensive saw that is the quality of a toy saw you give your children. Their quality has suffered in recent years compared to the older tools I have of theirs.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha

customer_reviews.title: Game changer
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tool. Game changer. Wish I had bought it sooner. Cutting sheet goods has been changed forever. This thing is Awesome! Being nit-picky. I can say it leaves a smooth cut edge, but not fine furniture smooth. I ripped a bunch of oak plywood down for furniture and for this particular easy going client I never considered recutting. But for a truly fine furniture smooth cut I will plan to cut oversize in the future and shave to final size with my table saw. I am very happy with the speed, ease of use, and quality of this awesome saw. Don't let my nit-picking scare you off.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip

customer_reviews.title: Terrible, sent it back
customer_reviews.text: Terrible unit for my applications. Not nearly accurate enough, track was difficult to use so I sent it back and upgraded to the Festool Tracksaw. Yeah its way more money but the festool works like a charm, perfect and easy to use. You get what you pay for ... with out a doubt! If you can swing it go the Festool route and you will not be displeased. I REALLY wanted to lvoe this as I have a Makita 4x24 belt sander which I love... this time they fall a bit short.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Lemoi

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny if you like tools that work right and exceed your expectations.
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting to purchase a track saw for quite a while and did a bunch of research on which one to buy. Over and over skilled woodworkers and tradesmen gave glowing reviews online for the Makita. There were definitely cheaper options, but I really can't stand fighting against cheap tools when I work. So, I decided to buy the Makita and I am extremely happy with my purchase. It is easy to use and makes super clean and accurate cuts right out of the box. It has plenty of accessories which are affordable. About the only thing that I don't like is that the depth gauge is metric, but I knew that from the reviews before I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Stroetz Fam

customer_reviews.title: OMG THIS IS AN AWESOME SYSTEM
customer_reviews.text: Don't ever buy a regular circular saw again, when TRACK SAWS exist. PERFECT CUTS!!!!! If you think you can cut a perfect straight line with a free hand, un-tracked circular saw, you are kidding your self. If your want your cut to be perfect, you need to buy this saw and guide rail combo. It takes several minutes to accurately set up the guide rail for your cut, but it is easy and worth it. The guide rail does NOT come with T-slot clamps that slide into the bottom of either end of the rail. Order those clamps and also the padded soft side storage bag for the rail. Seattle GRIZ!
customer_reviews.author: GRIZ

customer_reviews.title: Worth every Penny
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny!! I’m a contractor. I build and install cabinets. Can’t say enough good things about this saw. Saves me from having to unload the table saw sometimes. I can use it indoors (with shop vac attached)the dust port gets most of the dust due to the enclosed blade design. Very accurate and stays true even after taking it on jobs for about 2 years now. The only negative I can find is the motor seems a little underpowered. As long as I keep a sharp blade and move the saw at a reasonable speed, it still cuts 3/4” plywood fine. Overall...great saw! HUGE timesaver.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Guide rail severely bowed, ruining an otherwise good saw
customer_reviews.text: This saw itself is well constructed and precise. Easy to change the bevel, plunge height, and other basics. But it is *unusable* with the guide rail that was included. The rail is bowed from one end to the other, meaning it does not lay flat on the cutting surface. So as you move the saw down the track, the track lifts up at the ends and rotates on the center point, prohibiting it from keeping a pre-set line. I did some research and others have had quality issues with the rails, depending on where they were made. Only realized the issue after the 1 month return window on Amazon, so am trying to get an exchange from the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: D. C. Walsh

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: Super handy and pretty accurate. Update: July 7 2019 I dropped the stupid thing and it hit a corner of the base. That corner got bent upward but after checking the angle and checking to see if it still sits flat on the guide it works and cuts well. I put tape over the big opening used to remove the blade and it helped collect more of the sawdust.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Jacobo

customer_reviews.title: Makita Track Saw
customer_reviews.text: I'm a builder/woodworker with 40 years in the trades. Like most Makita tools I own (30 + tools) this is a solid tool. It's great for the Arts & Crafts style case work I do, compounded post with the tilt lock is so easy, as is beveling doors. Compared to my FT TS, cut quality is the same, more power, more of the things I use and less of the things I don't. Good all around .
customer_reviews.author: Brent Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Necessary for wood worker, get this one when quality and price is important to you.
customer_reviews.text: I have a walking closed using Makita track saw. I can't believe how easy it is to use it and the functionality it provides beats Kreg and Harbor Freight jigs (which are great when on the budget). This time since my project is much bigger and the quality of the cut and precision is very important, I have decided to "buy once cry once". Despise the cost, the money was well spent as the ease of use, precision are top notch. The dust extraction connector is very important to me. If you are looking for a quality tool which will last you and you don't want to spend an arm&leg (Festool) then get this one, and thank me later.
customer_reviews.author: Zetis

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: My old Craftsman saw died after 45 years, and I decided to upgrade to a track saw. They are all very expensive, but this seemed like the best value. I really like the zero clearance guide and the dust port. I use a dust collection system, and using the port I produced almost zero saw dust on the floor or on the board. The track keeps the saw from wandering, and gave a very sharp edge to the board. I just wish my old saw hadn't lasted so long.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The saw is fantastic! I purchased approximately two months ago to help ...
customer_reviews.text: First let me say that Makita arrived exactly on time as initial ETA. After reading reviews I was a little concerned that saw may arrive damaged as was mentioned in other reviews. Saw arrived in Makita hard plastic case that was packaged exceptionally well. I think seller listened to reviews on saws arriving damages on arrival. The saw is fantastic! I purchased approximately two months ago to help break down 3/4" plywood to be able to cut into further pieces on table saw. Saw cuts nice clean straight cuts everytime. I plan on using this to make many cabinets and shelves...I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Chesnut

customer_reviews.title: What an impressive Saw!
customer_reviews.text: I was really surprised at how great this saw and the track system performed. I use this for cleaning up the rough edges on chainsaw milled lumber. This leaves amazing edges and the edges join together with no gaps - on large glue ups. This saw has not had a power issue yet, i have cut as thick as i can go with it. I would highly recommend this track saw system to anyone. I have had this for about 4 months - i should have purchased this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: rblizz85

customer_reviews.title: Think about the track size you need before ordering
customer_reviews.text: I'm not going to repeat all the good things people say about this saw. Instead let's talk about track length. For me, 55inch was much longer than I need. If you're like me and want a shorter track, consider purchasing the saw alone and spend the difference on a shorter track. Makita sells a 39 inch track and Festool sells a 32 inch track. I'm going to take a risk and cut mine into 1/3 and 2/3.
customer_reviews.author: Corby

customer_reviews.title: Quality control???
customer_reviews.text: I always wanted a track saw and couldn’t justify buying the gold standard Festool. So I disregarded the negative reviews and ordered this makita. I was more concerned about the track being straight than anything. When I placed the saw on my table saw it rocked because the base was not flat. How could it remain flat on the track if it rocked. I put it back in the box and sent it back. I will save for the Festool...
customer_reviews.author: dp

customer_reviews.title: Not in love. Maybe not Makita's fault.
customer_reviews.text: Not in love and expected to be. Granted I bought a non Makita track as its partner (cuts way too close the metal track that it's hard to line up due to shadowing). Also, seems to lack some power... again, granted the first test was 1.5" maple butcher block. I think the blade is cooked after about 50' of that material. Had some issues with kick back while plunging, Maybe my technique or the material. For sheet goods, power should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No more crappy, non straight cuts with a circular saw using ...
customer_reviews.text: Life changing tool! With the ability to rip full sheet ply and other sheet goods as well as long camfer cuts, this is a total game changer in my shop. No more crappy, non straight cuts with a circular saw using a straight edge or dangers cuts on the table saw. Only suggestion for Makita would be to add a riving knife.
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it
customer_reviews.text: Love the clean straight cuts I get using this saw and track. Virtually zero chipping even on the waste side. Included blade has worked fantastically. So much better than using a regular circular saw and straight edge, especially if you can use some rigid foam or other sacrificial material under your cuts. Only regret is not spending a little more and going with the cordless version.
customer_reviews.author: Rm805

customer_reviews.title: I love this saw!
customer_reviews.text: This saw system does exactly what it claims- makes it very simple to cut long straight cuts in plywood or... I bought a second track and the makita track case. I did get a different brand of under track clamps with a speed trigger. The saw is amazing, has well thought out adjustments and settings and cuts exactly on your line. Who needs a $2000 panel saw!
customer_reviews.author: Gary F. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Buy the cordless!
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this saw except the cord! You have to be very careful not to catch the cord on something as you are cutting, or it will jerk the saw, of course. After using it on a jobsite this Summer cutting plywood sheets, I knew it would always be useful, but, I recently replaced it with the cordless version! Just as good if not better, and no cord to mess with. Someone will get a good deal on this corded version when I sell it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shoulda bought this one sooner
customer_reviews.text: One of those tools that, now that I have one, I wonder how I got along so long without it. Use it all the time. Makes glass-smooth, laser-straight cuts. No substitute for a good table saw, but perfect for breaking down sheet goods, trimming doors, or just ripping in the field where you can't bring your 300 lb table saw. Soft-start is a nice feature too. Only wish it came with optional inch markings on the depth gauge instead of metric only. A minor hassle, but easily overlooked given its advantages.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hennessy

customer_reviews.title: The best saw in my arsenal of saws. I build cabinets then some...
customer_reviews.text: Its perfect at what it is, cuts square, fast, and true. I use the festool track, so no issues with that, keep the blade sharp, as it will start to frag board edges with a dull thin kerf. Pay the extra and buy good blades. Compared to a wormdrive skill type saw, this is pretty quite too, made in England too not China. Love this saw.
customer_reviews.author: Mossback

customer_reviews.title: Really Glad I Bought One
customer_reviews.text: Had my doubts about a plunge saw Having over 25 years in the cabinet and remodel business I was very doubtful My doubts are put to rest For the price you can not go wrong with this Makita I am very happy I bought one and would highly recomend it to anyone A great buy for a really good price
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good saw, no sins.
customer_reviews.text: A very slick and accurate saw with no sins. Especially like the score setting: it cuts first at 3 centimeters prior to full cut to eliminate chipping. Slow start is appreciated as well to prevent kick-back. I see no reason to pay for track saws more expensive than this one unless you're ripping 4X4's or other heavy material. For plank and plywood this is a great unit. Cool carrying box too.
customer_reviews.author: jamescroak

customer_reviews.title: A better way to cut plylwood
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use, accurate, minimal or no tear out. Compared with giant outfeed tables on a table saw, this track saw and a couple of saw horses provides a much safer and more accurate means of cutting larger pieces of plywood. I especially appreciate the soft start, compared to my old wormdrive saw which jumps whenever I turn it on. Dust collection works well if you buy an appropriate connector for your shop vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: RWS

customer_reviews.title: Trim carpenter husband is very happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: Husband is a trim carpenter for over 32 years. Oh he is so happy with this. And he really like Makita circular saws so Makita having a track saw was a good move. I makes cutting doors off to the proper length very stress free. Many uses. Update: Husband commented again how much he really likes this saw and so did his helper.
customer_reviews.author: Green Cash

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could rip plywood sheets. So far its great. Used it to rip down some birtch plywood. No tear out or chipping. The rubber strip on the rail has to be trimmed before you make your first cut. I suggest just putting it on some Styrofoam and run the saw down the track. If you put a vacuum hose on the extractor port takes care of all the dust. Great saw so far.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Track Saw
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to shorten 6 panel doors when I laid 3/4 inch hardwood flooring. This saw cuts so clean I didn't even have to dress the edges on the bottom the door after cutting 9 doors. At just under half of what a Festool costs, this it the Best track saw for the money BAR NONE.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Hillman

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought this years ago!
customer_reviews.text: Used this saw, along with the 118" rail to cut down several sheets of 3/4" plywood to make some custom file drawers. Very clean cuts. Easy to use. The saw cut quick. The guide rail never slipped once. I had been using a circular saw against a guide rail & you have to hold it to the rail very tightly so it doesn't move. And you have to offset your measurements to account for the saw base. With this system, you simply make your marks & line up the guide rail on the marks. Very easy. The cuts were all clean enough to make good joints. I highly suggest it.
customer_reviews.author: Floyd Hatton

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last
customer_reviews.text: Worked ok at first but after the 1 year warrantee was up the motor burnt up with normal use. Not something I would expect for paying $400+ for a saw
customer_reviews.author: scott mcmahan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome saw
customer_reviews.text: This thing cuts so straight it’s amazing. I own a cabinet shop so I use table saws most of the time but I use this saw for butcher block, table tops, water fall edges and things of the sort. I even cut a 48” water fall edge 1 1/4” thick White oak lumber at a 45 degree angle and it cut amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Muller Family

customer_reviews.title: Great quality saw, good price
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been looking at track saws for a while And finally decided on this one. Works well, easy to set up, accurate. Fairly light weight. Good dust collection. I use it to breakdown sheets of plywood and MDF. Much better than my old circular saw and straight edge!
customer_reviews.author: RJF

customer_reviews.title: Superb saw
customer_reviews.text: Powerful and accurate with the track. I'm still learning all of the benefits, I used to have a $40 and never had the cut I wanted. I tried a table saw and it took up to much space, this saw has a nice case and the track stows easily in a small space.
customer_reviews.author: Ron King

customer_reviews.title: Better than Festool?
customer_reviews.text: My friend has the Festool. I bought the Makita. We compared them breaking down 3/4" Baltic Birch plywood. . They are similar. My friend said he liked the Makita a little better than the Festool. I like the Makita as well. I can confidently recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Objective Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: A total waste of a lot of money! I used to make better cuts using my circular saw a piece of aluminum angle stock. The saw has a bad habit of kicking back and the rubber strip on the edge makes it hard to align and difficult to duplicate cuts. Again, a tremendous waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Greg M.

customer_reviews.title: By far the best corded track saw in its class
customer_reviews.text: I shopped around and compared features across 6 or 7 brands and found the Makita to be superior even to its equivalent Festool TS55 model. The price differential just made it a done deal. I use mine professionally and don't know how I lived without it.
customer_reviews.author: Warren

customer_reviews.title: Great railsaw
customer_reviews.text: 90% as good as the Festool saw for 65% of the price. If you are using this every day, I’d get the festool system. For the guy using it a few times a month, get the makita. I think this will last me for many, many years.
customer_reviews.author: Rickmeister

customer_reviews.title: Best plunge saw I've used
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVE this saw. More accurate than any other I've tried. Light weight, and easy to set up. Makes cutting plywood and lengthwise cuts so much easier with NO variation from beginning to end. I would buy this saw again.
customer_reviews.author: maeja

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed.
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier. My table saw is now my boat anchor. The Makita track saw cuts real nice straight finished grade cuts on the 3/4 inch finish plywood that I am working with. Love it! It is now my go to saw. I made an 8 foot guide out of 1/2 inch finish plywood instead of purchasing a second rail for ripping sheets in length, I may buy more rail later.
customer_reviews.author: Mort Snerd

customer_reviews.title: Stay Away From This Saw
customer_reviews.text: Haven't been this disappointed in a tool ever. First time I went to use the saw it burned the wood and was hard to move along the rail. You are better off buying a better track saw or using a circular saw and straight edge. I returned this saw immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Iceman

customer_reviews.title: For me this saw is one of the best purchases made to date
customer_reviews.text: So much more than expected. For me this saw is one of the best purchases made to date. Granted it is not used everyday, but the benefits of when it is used are astounding. Once you are familiar with cutting this saw it can replace a table saw for cabinetry. Minor drawback is the height adjustment it is plastic to plastic hard to set for exact height.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Helton

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I have used this saw for various jobs that needed a straight line cut and could not use the table saw to achieve. WOW! Makes me wonder how I have lived w/o a track saw for so long. Easy to set up, easy to use, and the dust collection is superb. Now i just need the longer rail! Noticed that in several situations where i could not use rail clamps that the rubber backing kept the rail from shifting during use if reasonable care was taken. This has become a tool I would not live without.
customer_reviews.author: bernie kopfer

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. Great quality, works well. Its perfect for breaking down sheet goods. I would think twice before purchasing from amazon. I had multiple shipments get lost from them.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Much easier than setting up my panel saw, and ...
customer_reviews.text: Much easier than setting up my panel saw, and not limited to orthogonal cuts, very portable and convenient. Cuts not quite as straight as when using panel saw, but more than adequate for my purposes. This is actually the second one I've bought, the first one inaccessible to me, deep in storage in another state. Essential tool for me.
customer_reviews.author: electrical_tim

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for home use.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for putting in my oak stairs! I recommend for home use, not commercial use (a good bit of plastic). For the price - well worth the investment for a DIY guy.
customer_reviews.author: Herr Berg

customer_reviews.title: Simply Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Almost Festool, but a third cheaper. Quiet, precise, well made! Exceeded my expectations in that is is for all intents and purposes as functional as the Festool and will fit the Festool track. It is simply fantastic. I hope makita will make a solid line of accessories for it. That is where Festool shines, but at what cost.
customer_reviews.author: KTS

customer_reviews.title: I shouldn't have waited to get one
customer_reviews.text: I went back and forth for over whether I should buy this, and now I'm kicking myself for waiting so long. I've found myself using it all the time and it's a pleasure to use each time.
customer_reviews.author: Reuben

customer_reviews.title: Saw lasted 3 weeks beyond the warranty.
customer_reviews.text: We very much like the way this saw cut when we 1st got it. Being a do it yourself-er we haven't used it more than 5 times so it is almost like new. 3 weeks past the warranty the saw has taken a major dive and is throwing sparks from the motor. I spoke with Makita and they will look at it if I send it to Chicago and since it's past the warranty I will be billed for anything that needs to be fixed. If you want quality and something that will last then I would NOT recommend Mikata.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Bakken

customer_reviews.title: Should’ve bought this a long time ago!! Super nice!!
customer_reviews.text: My first plunge saw and I love this thing!! Perfect for cutting a straight edge on rough sawn lumber. With the proper ripping blade it goes through white oak and cherry like butter!
customer_reviews.author: Keith Mcfarland

customer_reviews.title: I am a track saw convert!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic saw. We processed 120 sheets of pressure treated plywood like it was nothing. Track grips exceptionally well and variable speed trigger makes cutting perfectly straight lines a breeze. One of my shop guys thought that a table saw was the better choice, but I believe he is a believer now as well. A must have for any shop.
customer_reviews.author: K. James

customer_reviews.title: It does everything festoon does for about half the price
customer_reviews.text: I have a festsaw about 12 years old and it started cutting poorly. I plan on getting it repaired but in the meantime thought I would give the Mikita a go. It works great. I can use my fest tracks so that was an insensitive so basically I have a new cutting system for the price of a saw.
customer_reviews.author: Mike monteforte

customer_reviews.title: It's awesome
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this saw! I wish I have purchased it years ago! The only thing I wish it has was an imperial scale but I will conform to the rest of the world and figure out the metric thing.
customer_reviews.author: Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Excellent saw
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the saw, blade, case, track, and instruction manual. All were easy to use and understand. I did watch some YouTube videos on the saw usage. These reinforced the manual nicely. The cuts were straight, easy to line up, and easy. The finished cuts were smooth with no tear out. Very happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Netts

customer_reviews.title: Best crosscut saw
customer_reviews.text: I bought this saw to help me the be able to make straight cross cuts on sheets of plywood. This is an awesome saw, very high quality tool. This saw is very easy to use and make perfect cuts every time. The case for the saw is great to store the saw. I am extremely satisfied with my purchase. I have been using the saw for about one year now. I highly recommend this crosscut saw.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great saw.  Should have purchased it sooner.
customer_reviews.text: Have used this saw for 2 months now. Makes cutting 3/4 plywood down to size so much easier and accurate, than cutting on tablesaw. I have a small shop, and I built a frame out out 2x4's which I mount on top of saw horses. Plywood goes on top of frame, measure twice, clamp the track, and cut. Nice clean and square cuts every time. I've built a workbench (fine woodworking plan), 2 shop cabinets, a miter saw station. Getting ready to build some kitchen cabinets. Makita tools have never let me down, and this track saw is terrific.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Track extensions don’t line up.
customer_reviews.text: I love the saw and the saw with one track only. I also bought a track extension so I could cut at lest 8’ lengths. However the track don’t line up with each other very well. I’m back to recutting everything on my table saw. Otherwise, 4-1/2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: DLApple

customer_reviews.title: Dream Saw
customer_reviews.text: Great item. Came in perfect condition right out of the box. Track was double boxed for protection. Cuts like a dream, and with dust collection attached, has virtually no saw dust. Really nice product.
customer_reviews.author: B. Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Great Addition to the Shop
customer_reviews.text: Works like a champ. Thought I would miss clamps for the rail but I haven't.. It seems to stay in place nicely. Can't say much about the unrestrained packing in the storage box for shipping. Nothing damaged but I would not be surprised if it was since the saw is loose in the box without any restraints or packing material.
customer_reviews.author: pkready

customer_reviews.title: Precision
customer_reviews.text: Extremely precise and about 2/3 the price of a Festool. Only issue is documentation on a few aspects are very good. Youtube takes care of that.
customer_reviews.author: JY

customer_reviews.title: Feels light, but remains effective.
customer_reviews.text: The saw travels along the guide really well. Not perfectly, but really nice. The plung action is super. The jury is stil out on the dust collection efficacy. I wind up using duct tape regardless of which of various shop-vacs I use. But, the end result is amazing. Wonderfully straight cuts which are easy to set up and have absolutely not chipping. Kudos.
customer_reviews.author: docpkrdude

customer_reviews.title: exactly what i wanted
customer_reviews.text: i hardly even use my table saw anymore. thanks makita for making good quality stuff
customer_reviews.author: Louis Lykins

customer_reviews.title: Verry good saw. Good accuracy
customer_reviews.text: A knock off of Festool which is excellent. Quite accurate and good controls and settings
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't come with a dust bag.
customer_reviews.text: Wish it came with a dust bag. Cant find one any where. Other than that works great.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Howard

customer_reviews.title: Strongly recommend this saw!
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use and amazingly accurate. I debated but I am SO glad I spent the money. Be warned though that you need to buy the rail clamps separate.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy N.

customer_reviews.title: Great saw.
customer_reviews.text: I reviewed many saws and this one ranks at the top.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence McCaffery

customer_reviews.title: Great saw so far.
customer_reviews.text: Ive only used this a few times since getting it. Worked great. I have always wanted a track saw since using a friend's Festool. What a great tool the track saw is! Perfectly straight, accurate cuts. The pricetag always deterred me because I wont use it very often, but when you do need one.......awesome tool to have. Makita's " lower than Festool" pricetag did it for me. Glad I finally bought one.
customer_reviews.author: RCD

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, stays put for the cut and tracks perfectly. Great tool.
customer_reviews.author: Gman-049

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to use.
customer_reviews.text: This product is very difficult to use. The track arrived warped, and the saw tends to jump off the track while cutting. I have stowed this saw away with no intention of using it again.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Williams

customer_reviews.title: Accurate
customer_reviews.text: The plunge saw met all my expectations regarding accuracy and ease of use. The rail system with its rubber base kept my cuts accurately on my cut line. The only area where improvements would be helpful is a more universal dust port size to connect to a standard shop vac.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Zuieback

customer_reviews.title: Move over Festool
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this, but I've been using one that my workmate owns and I think it's easier to use than the Festool. It's not more accurate, but it's a lot easier to use. I personally don't see any use for a cordless.
customer_reviews.author: BEEts

customer_reviews.title: This thing is pretty sweet. I got the track extension so I ...
customer_reviews.text: You don’t need to splurge for a Festool track plane. This thing is pretty sweet. I got the track extension so I can now rip down 4 x 8 sheets of plywood with ease without the fear of having to use my terrifyingly scary table saw!
customer_reviews.author: Ger

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Im doing some projects and Im glad I got this.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Good Investment. The saw is surprisingly light
customer_reviews.text: Good Investment. The saw is surprisingly light. It is precise. The dust collection system when hooked to a vacuum, is outstanding. Virtually no dust. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Makita Track saw
customer_reviews.text: This track saw is awesomeness!!!! I don’t know how I got along without it. I don’t hardly use my small job site table saw anymore! Especially for cutting bigger sheet goods down it’s so easy to set up. And it’s a huge timesaver. It’s so easy to use with clean professional results every time so far!!!
customer_reviews.author: Todd Wiley

customer_reviews.title: Saw works well - no issues with it
customer_reviews.text: Good quality track saw. Cut several glue edges on a variety of hardwoods and most did not need to be run through the joiner.
customer_reviews.author: CatDog

customer_reviews.title: This saw is great. Perfectly straight and square cuts effortlessly
customer_reviews.text: Oh boy. This saw is great. Perfectly straight and square cuts effortlessly. Makes cutting doors a stress free process with the scoring feature to eliminate tear out. Makes a lovely straight line rip ready for glue-up. I have not used the Festool model however, this cuts straight and square for about half the price and Makita is a real tool company. It is not as if you are buying a rigid track saw
customer_reviews.author: A. Sheva

customer_reviews.title: What a nice tool purchase this turned out to be
customer_reviews.text: What a nice tool purchase this turned out to be, why did I wait so long to get one?! Makes it so effortless to rip sheets, love this saw!
customer_reviews.author: David S. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Does everything I need it to do.
customer_reviews.text: Love this saw, will be buying other parts to expand the capability of this saw.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy Lazard

customer_reviews.title: Great saw and guide.
customer_reviews.text: Setup is intuitive. I got very accurate & smooth cuts with this saw. I couldn’t be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Lemoine

customer_reviews.title: Perfect cuts. Zero effort.
customer_reviews.text: A must have for woodworkers! No regret on pricing! You got what you paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Alfredo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I have not found anything yet that I don’t like about it . I purchased two additional 55”tracks and two sets of connectors instead of the 118” track. Along with the track bag because it is much easier to store. So far the saw and all accessories are awesome!
customer_reviews.author: George Coffman

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: It really makes cutting down large sheets of plywood easy. Do connect to some sort of dust extraction, it catches almost all the sawdust.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Caughron

customer_reviews.title: No regrets. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Can't get any better than this saw. Works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. G

customer_reviews.title: Great saw!
customer_reviews.text: Best saw I've ever owned. My cuts are so square they come with an egghead and a pocket-protector.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna C

customer_reviews.title: The first one came with a twisted track by about ...
customer_reviews.text: The first one came with a twisted track by about 1/4". Had to return the saw and track to get a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Jack of All Trades

customer_reviews.title: This is a great saw
customer_reviews.text: I build sets at a high school, two shows a year. I've had the saw for about 2 years now and still smile every time I use it. This thing is so much better than the old method of a straight edge or board and a heavy skill saw. Changing the depth of cut is quick and easy, nice straight cut. Well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Mike N.

customer_reviews.title: Accurate cuts
customer_reviews.text: I made accurate cuts on isometric 20mm mft cut station atop sawhorses. I even rip cut bowed lumber.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Soooo smooth
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. Great product, power, accuracy. If you have the money just do yourself a favor and buy this saw!
customer_reviews.author: Creations.BY.Claeys

customer_reviews.title: Very usefull tool
customer_reviews.text: I have already discovered a few new uses on various wood pieces I have made. It is very well made and a real alternative to struggling with a cut on an awkward piece on a table saw. The 3mm "rivcut" makes for a VERY clean cut, ready to join if you need to add a piece. No more fussing with the edge before biscuit joining.
customer_reviews.author: elf 1

customer_reviews.title: like cutting post formed countertops without chip out
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mainly for breaking down sheet goods and have found it also comes in handy for other things, like cutting post formed countertops without chip out.
customer_reviews.author: D. Clarkson

customer_reviews.title: Replaced an old skill saw
customer_reviews.text: We were using my father-in-law's old skill saw. Swear the thing would cut through anything you could throw at it, but it weighed a ton and was very hard to handle. Love this light weight plunge saw. Also bought the rail and have used it on plywood - works well.
customer_reviews.author: S. Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Good Saw
customer_reviews.text: Good saw...good cut. Not going to rehash what others have written... Best of all I can use this with the track and cut with either hand without contortions...Dust collection is terrific... Wouldn't want to be without it
customer_reviews.author: Pete K.

customer_reviews.title: The beez kneez!!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this thing!!! The cut is extremely smooth with no tear out and the accuracy would rival any table saw!!!
customer_reviews.author: Clinton

customer_reviews.title: Nice saw that makes very nice cuts
customer_reviews.text: Looked around a lot before buying this. Very easy to use, light and extremely clean and accurate cuts.
customer_reviews.author: Gary S. Beemer

customer_reviews.title: VERY happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: VERY happy with purchase. Had considered the Festool and the DeWALT offering. I'm very happy with my choice. Plenty of power. Very accurate. Getting splinter free cross grain cuts on oak plywood! Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie Hunt

product_meta.title: Makita SP6000J 6-1/2-Inch Plunge Circular Saw
product_meta.description:
Style:SawGet precise, accurate cutting and a splinter-free mirror finish, without the table saw. Makita's SP6000K 6-1/2-Inch Plunge Circular Saw delivers smooth, straight cuts. When you combine it with an optional guide rail system, constructed with anodized aluminum, the saw and rail system work together to produce accurate cuts with minimal tear-out. The saw combines a powerful 12 amp motor and a large cutting capacity with magnesium components for less weight and electronic speed control to maintain constant speed under load for smooth cutting and a splinter-free mirror finish. The SP6000K is a more portable option to a table saw and is ideal for use on the jobsite or in the shop. Maximum Cut Depth at 90 Degree- 2.188 inches.

AMAZON.COM
Get precise, accurate cutting and a splinter-free mirror finish, without the table saw. Makita's SP6000J 6-1/2-Inch Plunge Circular Saw delivers smooth, straight cuts. When you combine it with an optional guide rail system, constructed with anodized aluminum, the saw and rail system work together to produce accurate cuts with minimal tear-out. The saw combines a powerful 12 amp motor and a large cutting capacity with magnesium components for less weight and electronic speed control to maintain constant speed under load for smooth cutting and a splinter-free mirror finish. The SP6000J is a more portable option to a table saw and is ideal for use on the jobsite or in the shop. 

 


View larger SP6000J Features PERFORMANCE - Precision straight cutting delivers a splinter-free mirror finish 

SPEED - Variable speed dial control (2,000-5,200 rpm) 

CONTROL - Easy-to-set depth adjustment with large scale 

BEST FIT - Rubberized grip provides comfort and minimizes hand fatigue 

INCLUDES - 48T carbide-tipped blade, wrench, and stackable tool case 

Tool Specifications Blade Diameter 6-1/2" Arbor 20mm (13/16") Max. Cutting Capacity 
at 90° 2-3/16" Max. Cutting Capacity 
at 45° 1-9/16" No Load Speed 2,000-5,200 rpm Watts Out 1,300 AMPS 12.0 Length 13-3/8" Net Weight 9.7 lbs. Precision Settings and Features for Quality Cuts 
The saw has a bevel capability of -1 degree to 48 degrees with positive stops at 22.5 degrees and 45 degrees. The saw delivers precise cutting, as the position of the blade enters the material on the same cutting line whether cutting straight or bevel. In addition, the saw has close-to-wall cutting capability (11/16 inch) for expanded cutting applications. The built-in depth stop allows a preliminary cut of 1/16 inch to be performed before the entire material is cut, creating clean and splinter-free cutting.  12 AMP Direct-Drive Power for Smooth Cutting 
The SP6000J has a powerful 12 amp motor with soft start for smooth start-ups and Electronic Speed Control to maintain a constant speed under load for smooth cutting. The variable-speed dial control (2,000-5,200 rpm) allows the user to set the speed for optimum performance in a variety of materials. The built-in torque limiter helps prevent motor burnout. 

 Precision Cuts and Ease of Use 
The SP6000J saw includes a range of convenient features, including a large top handle and an electric brake for increased productivity. The saw also features a lock lever that attaches the saw to the rail system, so the saw stays on the rail when positioned for a bevel cut. The smooth and convenient plunge-release lever is designed for operator comfort, and the depth adjustment with large scale is easy to set. 

 Best in Class for a Range of Applications 
The SP6000J is engineered for cutting sheet material, finish work, trim work, and remodeling. It is ideal for a broad range of trades, including cabinet installers, cabinet manufacturers, finish carpenters, stair installers, flooring installers, woodworkers, and general contractors seeking a best-in-class 6-1/2-inch plunge circular saw. The SP6000J is another example of Makita's commitment to innovative technology and best-in-class engineering. 

 About Makita's Saws 
Cut after cut, Makita saws deliver power, performance, and capacity with less weight and more ease-of-use features. Makita has a full range of corded and cordless saws and blades for cutting wood, metal, and masonry, including table saws, miter saws, reciprocating saws, circular saws, jig saws, metal cutting saws, and plunge saws, as well as a complete line of blades and accessories. 

 About Makita 
Makita is a worldwide manufacturer of industrial-quality power tools and offers a wide range of industrial accessories. Makita applies leading-edge innovation to engineer power tools that are compact and energy efficient, yet deliver industrial-strength power and results. Makita U.S.A., Inc. is located in La Mirada, California, and operates an extensive distribution network located throughout the U.S. For more information, please call 800/4-MAKITA (800/462-5482) or visit makitatools.com. Makita is Best-in-Class Engineering. 

 Warranty 
Every Makita tool is thoroughly inspected and tested before leaving the factory. If you are not satisfied with any Makita tool within 30 days of purchase, return it and Makita will provide a replacement or refund. Each Makita tool is warranted to be free of defects from workmanship and materials for the period of ONE YEAR from the date of original purchase. Should any trouble develop during this one-year period, return the COMPLETE tool, freight prepaid, to one of Makita's Factory or Authorized Service Centers. Please see makitatools.com for complete details. 

 What's in the Box 
Makita SP6000J 6-1/2-Inch Plunge Circular Saw, 48T carbide-tipped blade, wrench, and stackable tool case.
feature_bullets: Powerful 12.0 AMP motor for optimum performance in a wide variety of materials
Precision accurate cutting delivers a splinter-free mirror finish
Electronic speed control maintains constant speed under load for smooth cutting
Variable speed control dial (2,000-5,200 RPM) enables user to match the speed to the application
Built-in current limiter helps prevent motor burnout
Soft start feature for smooth start-ups, Arbor (mm) : 20 mm, Track: 55-Inch
Large cutting capacity (2-3/16"" at 90° and 1-9/16"" at 45°)
